business.headline: Sensex gains 450 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today As of 10:20 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 391.07 points at 76,562.15, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 118.85 points to 23,164.10.
Sensex, Nifty open higher as cooling inflation boosts market sentimentThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 163.21 points to 76,334.39, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.25 points to 23,091.50 as of 9:30 AM.

Ajax Engineering IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and latest GMPAjax Engineering IPO allotment status: The IPO price band was set at Rs 599 to Rs 629 per share. The minimum lot size for the application was 23 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment required was Rs 13,777.

New Income Tax Bill to be tabled today: Here's what you can expectNew Income Tax Bill is expected to come into effect on April 1, 2026. The bill aims to simplify tax laws, remove outdated provisions, and make compliance easier for taxpayers.

Can a married couple save more taxes using both old and new tax regime?Married couples need to determine which tax regime offers lower tax liability for each spouse considering their income structure and deductions.

India's retail inflation dips to 4.31% in January, hits a five-month lowThe country's retail inflation witnessed a drop in January majorly due to declining food prices, according to data released by the National Statistics Office on Wednesday.

Sensex, Nifty recover sharply but end in red; M&M falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 122.52 points lower at 76,171.08. Earlier in the day, the 30-share index had plunged 850 points. Nifty, too, recovered strongly to end 26.55 points lower at 23,045.25.

Mutual fund inflows see slight dip in January. Here's whyThe flows declined 3.6% month-on-month to 396.88 billion rupees ($4.57 billion) from 411.56 billion rupees in December 2024, according to data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

New Income Tax Bill to introduce simpler 'tax year' concept: All you need to knowWhen the Income Tax Act of 1961 came into being it had 880 pages. Over the years, the act contained several amendments introduced in the various budgets.

Stock market bloodbath: Should buy the dip, exit or stay invested? The stock market correction has particularly hit retail investors, many of whom are contemplating selling their holdings at a loss. But is that the right move?

After 90-hour workweek remark, L&T chief stirs work-from-home debateThis is not the first time that the L&T Chairman's remarks have sparked a debate.  Earlier, he advocated a 90-hour workweek, which drew huge criticism.

Will retail inflation cool down further in January? Here's all you need to know The RBI mentioned continued reduction in rice prices and sharp corrections in the prices of vegetables, especially in the prices of onions, potatoes and tomatoes, in its January 2025 Bulletin.

L&T chief stirs fresh row with remark on labour crisis: Workers unwilling to moveSpeaking at CII's Mystic South Global Linkages Summit 2025 in Chennai, Subrahmanyan spoke about the difficulties faced by the construction industry in hiring and mobilising workers.

Sensex falls 700 points: 4 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged over 850 points before trimming some losses, trading 748.13 points lower at 75,545.47 by 10:23 am. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped nearly 1%, reflecting weakness across broader markets.
Sensex tumbles over 850 points as US tariff fears spook Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex nosedived 834.39 points to 75,459.21 at 10 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 251.95  points to trade at 22,819.85.

Madhya Pradesh: Rs 1,553 crore for Ladli Behna Yojana released. Check eligibilityLadli Behna Yojana aims to improve women's well-being, health, nutrition and economic independence. Presently, Rs 1,250 per month is given to all the eligible women under this scheme.

8th Pay Commission: Will its implementation face delays?Despite several measures announced for taxpayers in the Union Budget 2025, there was no mention of the financial impact of implementing the 8th Pay Commission.

Are you eligible for fixed medical allowance under NPS? Check details Retired central government civilian employees who are covered under the National Pension System will now be eligible for fixed medical allowance, announced the Department of Pension & Pensioners' Welfare.

Sensex ends 1,000 points lower: 5 factors behind today's stock market crashInvestors lost nearly Rs 10 lakh crore as selling pressure intensified across sectors due to various factors that dampened investor sentiment.

Sensex falls 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore on Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked by 1,1018.20 points to end at 76,293.60, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 309.80 points to close at 23,071.80.

entertainment.headline: Truth behind viral video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying over 'loss of work'Amid backlash over India's Got Latent, an old video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying resurfaces. In the video, the podcaster is seen breaking down over 'loss of work'.

Jonas Brothers hint at big change for 2025, shocked fans ask, 'another breakup?'The Jonas Brothers shared a letter on social media that briefly sent fans into a panic. In it, they hinted at their 2025 lineup and expressed gratitude to their fans for supporting them throughout their musical journey.

Kapil Sharma's 'Maa Baap ki Kabaddi' joke goes viral amid Ranveer Allahbadia rowAmid the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on Samay Raina's show India's Got Latent, an old clip of Kapil Sharma joking about kids watching "maa baap ki kabaddi" is going viral.

Watch: Did AR Rahman refer to Ranveer Allahbadia row at Chhaava music launch?AR Rahman made a humorous remark at the Chhaava music launch that has led to speculation about its connection to the recent controversy involving Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina.

Ed Sheeran's India dump features photo from football match with John AbrahamSinger Ed Sheeran shared his India dump, which also featured a glimpse of his football match with Bollywood actor John Abraham. Sheeran is in India for his Mathematics Tour.

Aly Goni feels Samay Raina was 'forced' to delete India's Got Latent episodesActor Aly Goni has commented on YouTuber-comedian Samay Raina's decision to remove episodes of India's Got Latent. Fans have also reacted to Samay's decision on social media.
Odia rapper Abhinav Singh, 32, dies by suicide in BengaluruA rapper from Odisha, Abhinav Singh, died in Bengaluru where he was working for a private company. He was 32.

Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show is the most-watchedRapper Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show has become the most-watched Super Bowl show of all time, garnering an impressive 133.5 million views.

Too much to handle: Samay Raina deletes all videos from his show amid jokes rowComedian Samay Raina finally broke his silence on the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's remark on his show, India's Got Latent. He has confirmed deleting all the videos of the show, and also added that whatever is happening right now is too much for him to handle.

Amy Adams joins Javier Bardem in Cape Fear TV adaptationAfter Javier Bardem, actor Amy Adams is on board for the much-awaited Cape Fear TV adaptation. The release date for the show has not been announced yet.

Kanye West dropped by talent agency amid antisemitic, controversial actionsKanye West's controversial actions have led to his talent agency, 33&West, dropping him. The decision follows a series of antisemitic remarks and troubling social media posts by the rapper that have sparked widespread condemnation.

Samay Raina's show in Gujarat cancelled amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina's Gujarat shows have been cancelled following a controversy sparked by the latest episode of his show, India's Got Latent. The decision comes amid backlash after a distasteful comment by YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia on the show.

Sakamoto Days: With ex-assassin's potential match, the anime is raising stakesSakamoto Days follows the story of a legendary assassin who transforms into a family man. Now, with the introduction of an equally formidable enemy, the anime might finally pick up pace and raise the stake.
Aashram 3 Part 2 teaser: Bobby Deol's comeback as Baba Nirala promises more twistsAashram 3 Part 2 teaser is out. The upcoming riveting crime drama marks the return of Bobby Deol as Bala Nirala.

Anupamaa actor Gaurav Khanna opens up on being colour-blind on Celebrity MasterchefTV actor Gaurav Khanna appeared on Celebrity MasterChef where he opened up about being colour-blind. He participated on the show along with Ayesha Jhulka.

BTS' V named world's most handsome man. Hrithik Roshan, Brad Pitt also on listBTS singer V aka Kim Taehyung has been named as the world's most handsome man. The list also features Indian actor Hrithik Roshan, Hollywood stars Brad Pitt, Tom Cruise, Bradley Cooper, among others.

Picture This trailer: Simone Ashley, Hero Fiennes to headline new romantic comedyThe trailer for Simone Ashley and Hero Fiennes Tiffin's film, Picture This, has been unveiled. It will release on Prime Video on March 6.

Jackson Wang announces MAGIC MAN 2 – A raw and vulnerable chapterJackson Wang is set to release MAGIC MAN 2, an album that delves into the stages of grief and personal growth. After a year of introspection, he presents a raw and authentic portrayal of his journey.

Pop girl group XG take their 'The first HOWL' World Tour to Latin-America  XG, a dynamic hip-hop/R&B-inspired girl group, is set to captivate audiences in Latin America with their inaugural concerts in Brazil and Mexico. As they continue their world tour, XG unveils a groundbreaking project, 'XDM Unidentified Waves,' that redefines their music and solidifies their global appeal.

Singer Liam Payne was struggling with sexuality, coerced ex to abort: ReportA new report reveals late One Direction star Liam Payne struggled with his sexuality and allegedly pressured ex-fiancée Maya Henry to terminate a pregnancy.

general news.headline: Pakistan violates ceasefire along LoC, suffers 'heavy casualties'Pakistani troops violated ceasefire by resorting to unprovoked firing on Indian posts along the Line of Control (LoC) in Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir, prompting a befitting response by the Indian Army.

PM Modi arrives in Washington DC, to hold bilateral meet with Donald Trump  Live UpdatesPM Modi will be the fourth world leader, after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Japan's Shigeru Ishiba and Jordan's king Abdullah II, to meet Trump in his second presidential term.

He has confirmed deleting all the videos of the show, and also added that whatever is happening right now is too much for him to handle.

NDA '300 paar' if Lok Sabha polls were held today, Congress slips: MOTN pollThe Mood of the Nation opinion poll shows that the Congress-led INDIA bloc, which punched above its weight to win 232 seats in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, will be down to 188 if the elections are held today.
Wait, what? Should you not rinse after brushing your teeth?According to several viral videos on the Internet, you should avoid rinsing after brushing your teeth. But what do dentists say?

Aimed at ending Russia-Ukraine war, Trump speaks to Putin, ZelenskyyWith the aim of ending the Russia-Ukraine war, US President Donald Trump said that he spoke to both Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

Indian-origin Paul Kapur, a Pak critic, is Trump nominee for top South Asia jobPaul Kapur, an expert on India-Pakistan security and nuclear issues, has been nominated to be the Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia.

Work from home, not from car while driving: Bengaluru police to womanA woman was fined for using a laptop while driving in Bengaluru. The video of her doing so was trending on social media, and the traffic police used it to track down the woman and fined her Rs 1,000.

PM gives heritage-inspired gifts to JD Vance's children. Here's what he chose Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who met JD Vance and his family in France on Wednesday, presented gifts to his three children.

Watch: Leopard gatecrashes Lucknow wedding, frantic guest jumps out of roofHundreds of guests ran out to the streets as a result of the leopard's sudden straying into the wedding venue. One person was seriously injured after jumping out of the roof in panic.

Dokra artwork, silver table mirror: PM Modi's gifts for Macron, French First LadyPrime Minister Narendra Modi was on a two-day visit to France, during which he co-chaired the AI Action Summit with President Emmanuel Macron and also inaugurated the first-ever Indian Consulate in the city of Marseille, among a host of other things.

Bridget Jones Mad About the Boy review: A warm, poignant end to a beloved storyReleased-Fri Feb 14, 2025Bridget Jones: Mad About the Boy review: Renée Zellweger's film is a heartfelt, funny, and ultimately satisfying conclusion to Bridget's journey. It reminds us why we fell in love with her in the first place.

Class 12 student dies by suicide after JEE-Mains result in UP: 'Sorry mummy, papa'The 18-year-old student was enroled at a private coaching institute in Gorakhpur. She was allegedly devastated by her low marks in JEE-Mains and decided to take the drastic step.

Exclusive: Mrs director on what 'triggered' her to remake The Great Indian KitchenArati Kadav talked about Mrs, a Hindi remake of The Great Indian Kitchen, and how it highlights patriarchy, invisible labour of women, and societal expectations. She also reflects on using personal experiences in the film.

In it, they hinted at their 2025 lineup and expressed gratitude to their fans for supporting them throughout their musical journey.

Why Dhaka book fair stall shutdown over Taslima Nasrin rings alarmThe Amar Ekushey Book Fair incident reflects a larger issue within Bangladeshi society as Islamist groups gain influence, spotlighting the threat to free speech

3 towers, hospital, library: Inside RSS's Rs 150-crore high-rise Delhi officeRSS's swanky new headquarters in New Delhi flaunts three high-rise towers, each G+12 floors, catering to different operational needs.

Pietersen slams England for no training: You're paid to win, not play golfFormer England captain, Kevin Pietersen and former India head coach Ravi Shastri blasted England for not holding enough practice sessions on the tour of India.

AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj turns Berozgar YouTuber after polls lossAfter losing the Greater Kailash seat in the 2025 Delhi Assembly election, former minister Saurabh Bharadwaj has turned to YouTube. The AAP leader, who was elected from GK thrice, posted a video on his YouTube channel, Berozgar Neta, saying the loss flipped his life by 180 degrees. He has promised to discuss new topics daily.

How College Romance could bail out Ranveer Allahbadia, Samay RainaComics and YouTubers, including Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina, have been booked in two states and charged with obscenity. In this context, it is interesting to revisit a Supreme Court verdict of March 2024 in the College Romance case. In that case, the SC made a clear distinction between obscenity and obscene language.

Laughable: Gaurav Gogoi on BJP claiming his wife has links with Pakistan, ISIGaurav Gogoi alleged that the BJP had carried out a similar "smear campaign" against him and his family ahead of last year's Lok Sabha polls and the people, in reply, elected him from the Jorhat parliamentary constituency.

MOTN poll shows Left slowly losing ground in Kerala. Will that be BJP's gain?The latest Mood of the Nation survey shows that the Left is fast losing its base in Kerala, the only state where it still has any sway. And Left's loss seems to be BJP's gain which is steadily increasing its vote share in the state.

Scarlett Johansson blasts 'paralysed' US government over AI video on Kanye WestActor Scarlett Johanson reacted to the viral AI videos of celebrities opposing rapper Kanye West over his anti-Semitic remarks.

It reminds us why we fell in love with her in the first place.

Mandy Moore attacks Amazon for delivering to in-laws's fire-ravaged homeActor-singer Mandy Moore criticised Amazon for delivering a package to her in-laws' home in Pasadena, which was completely destroyed in the California wildfires. Reportedly, the global giant responded and issued an apology.

sports.headline: Champions Trophy: Spencer Johnson hoping to replicate Mitchell Starc in PakistanAustralia's Spencer Johnson is hoping that he can replicate senior left-arm pacer Mitchell Starc's heroics during the upcoming Champions Trophy in Pakistan. Johnson has been picked as a replacement for Starc in the squad for the tournament.

RCB captaincy announcement Live: Kohli, Patidar in mix to lead in IPL 2025RCB captaincy announcement live updates: The Royal Challengers Bengaluru are all set to name their new captain on Thursday, February 13. Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar are the two names in the mix to be named as the skipper of the Bengaluru franchise for the IPL 2025 season.

IPL 2025: Virat Kohli, Rajat Patidar frontrunners for RCB captaincy roleIPLL 2025: Virat Kohli and Rajat Patidar are frontrunners to be named as the new Royal Challengers Bengaluru skipper for the upcoming IPL 2025 season. Both men were retained by the franchise ahead of the new season.

Buttler backs England teammates after India loss, rejects 'unserious' claimsJos Buttler defended his England teammates after their 3-0 ODI series defeat to India, dismissing criticism from the likes of Kevin Pietersen and Ravi Shastri, who questioned England's training approach and preparation ahead of the Champions Trophy.

Dangerous Afghanistan set for bigger heights on debutChampions Trophy 2025: Hashmatullah Shahidi's Afghanistan might not be the outright favourites to win the tournament, but are more than capable to taking down of the big teams. Their campaign starts on February 21 against South Africa in Karachi.

No Champions Trophy warm-up matches for India, Australia and PakistanChampions Trophy 2025: India and Australia have opted out of Champions Trophy warm-ups, while Pakistan has scheduled three with their Shaheen squads. Rohit Sharma's squad will rely on their ODI series win over England as sufficient preparation for the tournament in Dubai.

Parthiv Patel explains why Harshit Rana is more effective with old ballIND vs ENG: Parthiv Patel said that Harshit Rana is a hit-the-deck bowler and hence, he gets more wickets with the old ball. Rana finished the top wicket-taker amongst pacers in the ODI series against England.

How Shreyas Iyer countered his short-ball weakness, reveals former batting coachFormer India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has given his insights on how Shreyas Iyer countered his short-ball weakness in the recent ODI series against England.

Who said what as India beat England 3-0 before Champions Trophy IND vs ENG: Rohit Sharma was happy with India's outings in the ODIs against England. Jos Buttler, on the other, said that the Three Lions couldn't make use of the chances India gave them throughout the series.

Varun Chakravarthy could be our X factor for Champions Trophy: Gautam GambhirIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir feels wrist spinner Varun Chakravarthy could be the team's X factor in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Chakravarthy was the last minute addition to India's squad for the tournament as he replaced Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Harshit ready to give his best in Champions Trophy after earning Gambhir's trustIndia fast bowler Harshit Rana revealed that he had begun his preparations for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 long back as Gambhir had conveyed to him that he was in contention to replace Bumrah.

Don't judge Shubman Gill after every innings: Gautam GambhirAfter Shubman Gill's incredible ODI series against England, India head coach Gautam Gambhir requested the fans to not judge young players after every innings. Gambhir has said that Gill could become a great batter in the next few years if backed in the ODI and the Test format.

One of my better knocks: Gill happy with century on 'tricky' Ahmedabad pitchIND vs ENG: Shubman Gill scored 112 runs off 102 balls with 14 fours and three sixes as India beat England by 142 runs on Wednesday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

KL Rahul is India's No. 1 keeper, Rishabh Pant will get his chance: GambhirIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir has called KL Rahul India's number one wicketkeeper ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. He also said that Rishabh Pant will get his chances.

RCB to announce captain on Feb 13: Is Virat Kohli taking up role? IPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are all set to announce their new captain for the upcoming edition. After Faf du Plessis was released, RCB need a new skipper to take over from the South African.

Watch: England's snoozefest in Ahmedabad puts Jofra Archer to sleep in dugoutIndia vs England: England fast bowler Jofra Archer fell asleep in the dugout during England's batting in the 3rd ODI match on Wednesday. England failed to turn up with the bat and lost the game by 142 runs.

KL Rahul should not be wasted at No.6: Parthiv Patel after rapid Ahmedabad cameoIndia batter KL Rahul returned to his preferred No.5 position in the 3rd ODI against England. Rahul scored a quickfire 40 runs off 29 balls, helping India post a total of 356 runs.

Shubman stars as India warm up to Champions Trophy with 3-0 sweep vs EnglandShubman Gill's execellent hundred and a complete bowling performance helped India clean sweep the ODI series against England. The Jos Buttler's side failed to put up any resistance in Ahmedabad, losing the final match by 142 runs.

Pietersen dissects Kohli's troubles vs Rashid: Shouldn't be getting out like thatFormer England cricketer Kevin Pietersen shared his views on star India batter Virat Kohli's dismissals against Adil Rashid. Kohli was dismissed by Rashid for the 11th time in international cricket during third ODI.

Kerala set up semi-final clash with Gujarat after 1-run lead vs J&KRanji Trophy: Kerala made their way through to the semi-final after taking a first innings lead in their quarterfinal against Jammu & Kashmir. Kerala will now be up against Gujarat in the semis.

Sachin Yadav, 25, wins javelin gold in National Games with personal best throw25-year-old Sachin Yadav broke the National Games record, winning the gold in men's javelin event in Dehardun on Wednesday. Sachin achieved a new personal best of 84.39m to win the top prize.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
